adverbs.description: incredibly (comparative more incredibly, superlative most incredibly)

entries.meaning: (manner) In an incredible manner; not to be believed.
examples: With the parental exaggeration which the birth of his various enterprises always induced, O'Sullivan spoke incredibly of eighty-five "enrolled" members.

entries.meaning: Used to note the surprising or hard-to-believe nature of what is being said and suggest that it is nevertheless true.
examples: Incredibly, when he died they found he had left a million dollars to the Poetry Foundation.
